abstract.p: Jack Taylor letter comments on Jay Weiser's June 24 Op-Ed article on decision by New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission to reject plans for 17-story apartment tower in Carnegie Hill Historic District following protests by Woody Allen, neighborhood resident

block.p: Woody Allen's Nimbyism, mocked in ''To Some an Eyesore, to Others a Home,'' by Jay Weiser (Op-Ed, June 24), was put to the service of Midtown South, far from his home in the Carnegie Hill Historic District, when in 1986 he called for the landmark designation of the Ladies' Mile Historic District, finally established three years later.

Woody Allen's Nimbyism, mocked in ''To Some an Eyesore, to Others a Home,'' by Jay Weiser (Op-Ed, June 24), was put to the service of Midtown South, far from his home in the Carnegie Hill Historic District, when in 1986 he called for the landmark designation of the Ladies' Mile Historic District, finally established three years later.

We are all Nimbyists who seek to preserve and protect New York's significant neighborhoods, no matter where in the five boroughs, and have long since welcomed Mr. Allen into that no-longer-pejorative fraternity.
The writer is president, Drive to Protect the Ladies' Mile District.
